data.name: In a temper!
data.description:
You are a composer - everyone else is using 12-tone equal temperament, which is so pass√©. So you decide to explore other equal temperaments. The problem? You've lost all of the papers with your intervals, leaving you in a temper!

# Challenge
Create a program which returns all the interval coefficients between 1 and 2, inclusive, for `n`-tone equal temperament.


# Important definition
Equal temperament is a system of creating pitches between a given note and the octave above (with 2x the frequency of the given note). In this kata, the intervals given in the arrays represent the coefficients required to get from a given note to the note n intervals above it.

Given `n`-tone equal temperament:

`pitch * coefficient = new_pitch` 

where `coefficient` in `[1, 2^(1/n), 2^(2/n), ..., 2^(n-1/n) , 2]`

# Things to note
`n` will always be a positive, non-zero integer

Reference: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Equal_temperament
